meanings.sent1: I have my book, and nothing else.
meanings.sent2: She wanted to go somewhere else for vacation.
meanings.sent3: He brought his lunchbox, but nothing else, to the picnic.
meanings.sent4: The stars twinkled brightly in the sky, but nothing else could compare to their beauty.
meanings.sent5: The cake was delicious, but nothing else on the menu seemed as tempting.

meanings.sent1: She picked out a different dress from the rest.
meanings.sent2: The store had various options, but she chose a different one.
meanings.sent3: The cat had a different idea about where to hide its toy.
meanings.sent4: The new student brought a different energy to the classroom.
meanings.sent5: The different flavors of ice cream made it hard to choose just one.

meanings.sent1: You should study; else, you might fail the test.
meanings.sent2: She needed to hurry, else she would miss the bus.
meanings.sent3: He had to finish his homework, else he would get in trouble.
meanings.sent4: The chef needed to add salt; else, the dish would taste bland.
meanings.sent5: She had to leave now; else, she would be late for the appointment.
